data.title: Outside Resources
data.text:
The Historical Reference Branch answers many thousands of written, telephone, and in-person requests each year. The historians are available to answer questions or direct researchers to appropriate holdings. The branch maintains a large body of secondary and copies of primary historical sources collected over many decades to answer the questions received. Visiting researchers are welcome to review materials in the branch's Researcher Room. Please note that staff limitations preclude this office from conducting extensive research or doing extensive copying for individuals.

VISITING RESEARCHERS:

STAFF ASSISTANCE: The Historical Reference Branch staff is available BY APPOINTMENT ONLY to explain the various holdings of the branch and assist in making the desired materials available in the branch's Researcher Room. The staff will also direct researchers to appropriate records and other related holdings and agencies. To make an appointment, please call 703-432-4874 or email history.division@usmcu.edu.

COPYING: All materials for copying must be reviewed by a member of the Historical Reference Branch.

HOURS: Monday-Tuesday and Thursday-Friday, 7:30 am - 4:00 pm. The office is closed on Wednesdays.

Please Review the Following Information Regarding Conducting In-Person Research.

OTHER RESEARCHERS:

WRITTEN REQUESTS: Researchers may write to the Historical Reference Branch with requests for historical information. The address is:

Marine Corps History Division

Attn: Historical Reference Branch

2044 Broadway St.

Quantico, Virginia 22134

Or

history.divsion@usmcu.edu

Please note that staff limitations preclude this office from conducting extensive research or doing extensive copying for individuals.

TELEPHONE REQUESTS: The Historical Reference Branch will respond to telephone requests if information is readily available. The telephone number is: 703-432-4874.
